result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for November 7, 2022 at 03:00 pm.

10:42 AM Defendant George J. Wolfe Jr. in court, in custody.  Attorney Adam J Snavely in court for George J. Wolfe Jr.  ADA Dennis Brown in court for State of Wisconsin. Victim not in attendance. Bond Continued
Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for September 12, 2022 at 01:30 pm.

3:25 PM Defendant George J. Wolfe Jr. in court, in custody.  Attorney Adam J Snavely in court for George J. Wolfe Jr.  Attorney Karl Peter Hayes in court for State of Wisconsin. Defense has received copy of information.  Waive formal reading.  Not guilty pleas entered. Bond continued.
Judicial Pretrial - in court scheduled for June 22, 2022 at 09:30 am.
Judicial Pretrial - in court on June 22, 2022 at 09:30 am.

8:33 AM Defendant George J. Wolfe Jr. appeared by video, in custody in the Vilas County Jail.  Attorney Adam J Snavely appeared by video for George J. Wolfe Jr.  Attorney Karl Peter Hayes in court for State of Wisconsin. Right to be personally present at today's hearing explained to defendant.  Defendant confirms that he/she would like to proceed without being personally present in court.  Court finds that defendant agreeing to proceed by phone/video means, and waiving right to be personally present in court for today's proceedings. Waiver of preliminary hearing.  Rights given.  Court finds that waiver is done so knowingly and voluntarily.  Probable cause found.  Bound over for arraignment on an information.  Information to be e-filed.  Waive reading.  Not guilty pleas entered.  Bond continued.
Arraignment scheduled for May 31, 2022 at 03:15 pm.
